Random thing:

http://www.rabbitmq.com/ - an Erlang-based implementation of AMQP
message (queueing, etc) protocol states that it has an experimental POP3
binding...

Ben


On Fri, 2009-05-01 at 08:34 -0400, Bill Burke wrote:
> 
> 
> I wonder why nobody has picked up using email, smtp/pop3, as an 
> asynchronous protocol for the Internet. It has scaled pretty well.
> Has 
> a constrained interface. Has a strong infrastrutre base of tools. Is 
> representation oriented and media-type aware. Pretty ubiquitous.
> 
> -- 
> Bill Burke
> JBoss, a division of Red Hat
> http://bill.burkecentral.com
> 
> 
> 
>
